channel.title: Hackthebox on PysKa's Writeups
channel.description: Recent content in Hackthebox on PysKa's Writeups

item.title: Hackthebox Redpanda
item.description:
Foothold

/etc/hosts

Before anything else, I’ve added the following lines to my /etc/hosts:

10.10.11.170	redpanda.htb

So now I can use “redpanda.htb” instead of passing IPs everywhere.

NMAP

A nmap scan of the top 1000 ports gives us: 

# Nmap 7.93 scan initiated Tue Sep 27 16:59:36 2022 as: nmap -Pn -sS -A -p1-65535 -O -oN nmap_tcp_all.txt -vvvv redpanda.htb

Host is up, received user-set (0.048s latency).

item.title: Hackthebox Shoppy
item.description:
Foothold

/etc/hosts

Before anything else, I’ve added the following lines to my /etc/hosts:

10.10.11.180	shoppy.htb

So now I can use “shoppy.htb” instead of passing IPs everywhere.

NMAP

A nmap scan of the top 1000 ports gives us: 

# Nmap 7.93 scan initiated Fri Sep 23 19:28:02 2022 as: nmap -Pn -sS -A --top-ports 1000 -O -oN nmap_tcp_top_1000.txt -vvvv shoppy.htb
Nmap scan report for shoppy.htb (10.10.11.180)

PORT STATE SERVICE REASON VERSION
